comments.commentBody: that's kind of misandrous.
WOW!

Odd. Whenever I see the North Korean leader, there are always aides surrounding him with paper and pencil, apparently scribbling down every word the leader fires. But one would think in a nation that is testing missiles or working to develop  or has nuclear weapons, pencil and paper should be passé, and IPads would have long been launched.

Steve,

You noticed that too! I would guess that those books are collected after the event and "graded" pass - no pass, a "no pass" gets you a trip to the gunnery range as a target for an A.A. gun.

North Korea may have 1950's technology but a few thousand tons of VX nerve gas released along its border with South Korea would kill hundreds of thousands of Koreans. The North would claim that the South or the Americans did it to make them look bad.

Most of those here at the NYT would believe them.

Nukes don't need complicated delivery systems. A tunnel and an Ox drawn wagon works just fine. Again blame the South and the Americans.

Again most here would believe the North.

Richard: Thanks for taking the time to read and to respond to my observation. You speak of tunnels. When I was in South Korea summer of 2015, I visited the DMZ and was able to tour an invasion tunnel dug by North Korea. The link below shows the path created by the South to reach the invasion tunnel.
https://www.flickr.com/photos/stevebrown1/19490191614/in/album-721576541...

"Most here would believe the North."
Why would you say, or think, such a thing?

This article is a classic scare piece. To what ends it is not clear. A bit of history on the Korean war would go a long way to explain the N. Korean behavior. Not including the historical context in this story is irresponsible. Being bombed by air nonstop for weeks by the Strategic Air Command does have lasting consequences in behavior.

Even more telling is that the saber rattling, espionage, and subterfuge have never been successful. This behavior in fact most likely encourages other countries to forge ahead. Some times it almost appears that this is in fact the desired outcome that is being sought by the USA.

"Being bombed by air nonstop for weeks by the Strategic Air Command does have lasting consequences in behavior."

As does invading one's neighbor to the south, which invited said bombing in the first place. It's not like General LeMay woke up one morning and said, "I think I'll bomb North Korea back to the stone age today." Okay, he probably woke up many mornings and said that but he didn't act on it without provocation.
Exactly. Apparently the US needs a new enemy, now that they are mostly done with Afghanistan and being kicked form Syria, why not mess up with Kim.

Stuxnet destroyed Iran's centrifuges, but Iran rebuilt. I agree that espionage actions like the computer viruses hurt both parties while engagement diplomatically works if given the time.

" Being bombed by air nonstop for weeks by the Strategic Air Command does have lasting consequences in behavior." If that were so, then how do you explain Vietnam? We bombed them for years and they still beat us while N. Korea probably has underground cities already prepared, so while I disagree with some of waht you said, I do agree that "Some times it almost appears that this is in fact the desired outcome that is being sought by the USA." Trump is putting a lot of money into the military and he wants a new navy which is absurd in the day of missiles like the one used on the USS Stark.

I read your extraordinary words just as I had opened a window in central London to better hear the sound of a rally gathering in the next square. Thousands of medics and other hospital workers are marching today in support of Britain's National Health Service, the NHS. That same NHS treated me for a woman's cancer in the 80s, when I was a young bride. My marriage did not survive that time, and I have grieved the loss ever since. To the heart-felt comments already expressed, I would simply like to add: thank you, for reminding me what love is. The march is moving below me now; an army of people who work to heal. With so many others, I am wishing you a miracle.

This was a wonderful response from London.  We in America march for the continued life of the Affordable Care Act so that more Amy Krouse Rosenthals can be diagnosed and treated humanely and with insurance.

"He could press the Chinese to cut off trade and support, but Beijing has always stopped short of steps that could lead to the regime’s collapse."

Yay! China, the country from which we buy all of our stuff! We support the country whose support of North Korea is the only reason it still survives!

Doesn't that give you a warm feeling inside, America?

Cooler heads? I guess that's a typical leftie slap at Trump. The "cool-headed" and very Democrat Kennedy brothers precipitated Castro to seek Russian missiles by seeking to topple him with the Bay of Pigs fiasco. Their next "cool-headed" foray: Viet Nam. I guess Trump isn't the only one who seems to have a one-sided grasp of history.
Makes ya feel safe that we now have such a steady, competent Commander in Chief, doesn't it? :(
Who could ever imagine that being President could be so complicated?
No one.  No one knew.
I throw out the white ones too. I hope my reading this finds you still with us. I'm not looking for love, though I'd love to know more people like both of you. Keep in touch.
Whatever Trump does I'm sure it'll be bigger and better and if it doesn't work out it'll be someone else's fault
Maybe the Donald can ask his mentor Vlad Putin how to effectively use cyber and electronic warfare against another country to meddle in its affairs.
One cannot be sure he has not contributed to the cyber attacks in cahoots with our enemies.

I know that you and I would be fast friends Amy. Since you are among the small percentage of people who found that amazing love, you may be among the small percentage of people who defy the odds of ovarian cancer and have many more years here. Miracles do happen. In regard to Jason,  Jason is Jason because you are Amy. He is that way because of how he feels about you. Coffee smileys and colored, non-white gum balls are just the greatest example. My wish for you both is that the peace found in great love will last a lifetime, however long or short that may be. ❤
Thank you so much.  Your love is eternal and breeds intense gratitude as I lay quietly next to my wife sleeping beside me this Saturday morning.
recusal means nothing, he still in charge of the DOJ.
If this shabby-wannabe-Godfather-lie-tweeting-Putin-kissing 45 is all that stands between us and North Korea's nukes, then start building those fallout shelters.

Please be responsible:....Trump is mentally ill according to Lance M.Dodes
M.D. and 35 of his colleagues of The American Psychiatric Association..
and warns Editors of NYTimes...Letter Feb 13, 2017....
Trump cannot act responsibly....has not acted responsibly..
Amendment 25: Section 4 will be the means to dismiss Trump as medically/
mentally unfit to serve as President.
The Congress has the power to dismiss the President...Please report on
this finding NOW.

Naturally, I wanted THE THLOT PICKENS, but that's just me.
For 42A Cavils, I wanted BUTS. (Pretty sure the Deicer formula is some other salt, but can't come up with it, so NaCl it is.)

Worst part of this amazing GRID (erase, erase) for me, was 16A. I did a minor in ART. There is no such thing as ART I. You take Drawing, Composition, Color, Mixed Media, ART in the Elementary School, Fiber ARTs, ART history, and so on.

Mary Lou Guizzo wins the prize for Best Photo of a Puzzle Constructor :0)
Of its a new record for youngest constructor.

Thanks, MOL.

It was only your post that allowed me (finally) to parse ART I correctly.
THLOT PICKENS? SLIM chance.

America has been lulled into complacency about how the checks and balances in the Constitution can protect the country from a despotic President. The only way the Constitution works in that regard is if either or both houses of Congress are not the same party as the President. It cannot help in the case of a unitary government where Congress and the President are all the same party. This is a glaring hole in Constitutional protections.

The result is that a President can run amok and evolve into a despot, completely unfettered by any controls at all. No investigations can be chartered without Congressional or Executive branch approval. No resolutions or laws can be passed to reign in the unreignable. No court can stop a despot in a timely or sufficiently broad manner. Nothing can be done to stop an out of control President from tearing the country apart, and that is happening now. Just ask the brains behind this destruction, Steve Bannon, what his intents are.

The first and foremost thing which must be done is to remove Bannon, Miller, and the other Breitbart alt-right knuckle draggers. They were not elected, and they have no business defining the direction of the country.

Why have the Democrats not focused on this? It's all well and good to chip away at Sessions and the Russians, but the core of the Trump administration is rotten with treason. Their exit must be defined and executed.
Given that North Korea is financially depressed, has a heavily indoctrinated population, and has a leadership prone to assassination of its family members, I would not put anything past them.

Mr. Trump's most urgent problem is to dismantle 240 years of democracy as rapidly as possible then establish himself as the first American dictator. After that he will tackle fake problems that make it appear he is protecting the country from all the bad hombres.
Good grief.
I was with you until "fake problems." North Korea's ability to annihilate us at the hands of a regime that just may be crazier than Trump himself does not constitute a "trumped up" problem.

Oh, Amy. So much love follows you on your journey - not only the love of your husband and children, but of everyone privileged to read this beautiful piece, brimming with praise and poignancy. To the rest of the ladies out there: First, give poor Jason a breather before you rush in. Second, if you are of Jewish descent, get tested to see if you are a carrier of the BRCA-1 or BRCA-2 gene,  which not only raise your lifetime risk of breast cancer to above 80%, but also raise your risk of ovarian cancer to 33%. I found out about my BRCA-2 too late to save me from a bout of breast cancer, but in time to get my ovaries removed (I already had two lovely children). The post-surgery biopsy showed precancerous changes to one ovary. I had escaped by the skin of my teeth. My wish is that this warning helps someone out there, so she too won't be writing a dating profile for a wonderful man she doesn't want to leave. Amy, still praying for a miracle for you.
Every day is a miracle, darling, trust me.
The miracle is the love she has experienced. There are than medical miracles to be experienced in life.

I recently read "Without You There is No Us" which is a memoir written by a woman who taught a bunch of "elite" children in Pyongyang. Inevitably, that regime will fall. When it does we can expect a century of recriminations for not doing something sooner to rescue the people of Korea. It will be the Holocaust all over again, only this time, the world did nothing.

There are 24m people in North Korea who are living in conditions we can only imagine. Why a coalition of nations has not gone in and liberated them is beyond me...... Yeah. I know, we can't go around invading sovereign nations and there are trouble spots all over the world and blah blah blah but this should be the reason why we have a UN. To stop a kleptocracy from abusing their subjects for their own gain and in this case, to an extreme level.

So we haven't done much, and their nuclear power continues to grow. Why is a country who doesn't give a whit about its populace and whose brightest students are woefully ignorant--why is such a country so FOCUSED on nuclear armament?

Yes, it has deterred international intervention but their reach is widening. What to do about North Korea is the sleeping issue of our era. We punt it down the line but there will be a day or reckoning and it is NOT going to come from within.

But yeah, let's keep electing people like Trump who can't be trusted in ethics or competence.....

Gwe,

The reason for the North's existence and its creation in the first place can be explained in one word "China". China is in a worse position with the North than are we. What seemed a good idea in the '50s is looking worse and worse as the North builds more Nukes right next door to China.

The North is exactly the same country it was in 1950. China is nothing like the same country. There is evidence that China has had enough and is just waiting for something really bad to happen. Something "really bad will still leave legions of the dead however.

There is lots of blame to go around and it is likely that there was no military solution to the problem in the '50's short of WW3 with Nukes on all sides.

The US since Reagan all but annihilated the UN.
Ever since, we have run into more and more, bigger and bigger catastrophes.

Which could all have been prevented through the UN, and could have been handled much better, if we had a functioning and fully funded UN.

Actually North Korea was created by a couple of American policy analyst near the end of WWII. They simply drew a line through the middle of the country at the 38th parallel and allowed the Russians to occupy north of that and the Americans got south of that.

In 1949 North Korea donated some fighting divisions to Mao's Communist during the Chinese Civil war that ended playing an instrumental part in helping the Chinese prevail. A year later after the victory in China, those forces were back in Korea, highly trained and experienced. Dean Atchinson had recently given a speech in Japan saying the United States interest in Asia didn't extend past the Strait of Korea between Japan and Korea - a clear mistake on his part (he also did a mistake that triggered Japan to choose to decide to bomb Pearl Harbor). Kim decided that that meant that the U.S. would not bother defending South Korea. So with Mao in debt to Kim, Kim sought and got approval from Stalin to attempt to invade the south. Citing Atcheson's speach he aquiesced (after having turned Kim down several times before). Kim was correct in assessing his experienced and well trained forces created a power inbalance in his favor in 1950. He invaded the South in June 1950 and quickly overran front line forces, and Seoul, and the coordinated efforts of the North Korean army was so good that they easily overcame the first American units that they faced as well. Still by Nov 1950 it was necessary for Mao to bail out Kim.
